key_points: The IRS letter about your third stimulus check is crucial for correcting errors or claiming missing payments.
The letter, officially called Notice 1444-C, arrives approximately 15 days after you receive your third stimulus payment.
It's important to keep the IRS letter for your records, as it can help you claim a recovery rebate credit for missing stimulus money.
If you didn't receive the letter or lost it, you can find the information in your federal tax account on the IRS website.
The IRS online registration process to access your tax account information can take about 15 minutes.
Those who have moved or changed addresses should inform both the IRS and the USPS.
You might be eligible for additional money if the IRS's calculation was based on outdated information, like income or dependents.
You can still claim a recovery rebate credit on your taxes if you're missing a stimulus payment, even after the tax filing deadline, if you requested an extension.
The article provides advice on tracking your stimulus payment and claiming back wages from employers.
The article offers resources like a stimulus check calculator and information on child tax credit payments.
